intro: Cynoglossum officinale var. parvifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features violet to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, resembling small bells, and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along roadsides. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
